bond

Class Observation

  • Object
    • bond.Observation

  • public class Observation
extends Object
    Class used to represent an observation. An observation is built up as a collection of (key, value) pairs using a builder-style pattern. For more information, see the class description for Bond.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Spies this point with the current observation, expecting a return type of expectedType.

      Spies this point with no observation, expecting an Exception to be thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • obs

        public Observation obs(String key,
                       Object value)
        Add a (key, value) pair to the current observation.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the value being observed
        value - Value to be observed
        Returns:
        This object to continue to be used in a builder-style pattern
        See Also:
        Bond.obs(String, Object)

      • spy

        public void spy()
        Spies with the currently built observation and an anonymous spy point.
        See Also:
        Bond.spy()

      • spy

        public SpyResult<Object> spy(String spyPointName)
        Spies with the currently built observation.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.
        See Also:
        Bond.spy(String)

      • spy

        public SpyResult<Object> spy(String spyPointName,
                             boolean skipSaveObservation)
        Spies with the currently built observation.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        skipSaveObservation - If true, don't actually save the observation; all other relevant SpyAgent actions are still performed. This will be overridden by the skipSaveObservation field of a SpyAgent.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.
        See Also:
        Bond.spy(String, boolean)

      • spy

        public <T> SpyResult<T> spy(String spyPointName,
                            Class<T> expectedType)
        Spies this point with the current observation, expecting a return type of expectedType. Has no effect and returns an absent SpyResult if Bond.isActive() is false.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Same as expectedType
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on
        expectedType - Type of value expected to be returned from any active SpyAgent
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.
        Throws:
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the result from the agent matching this spy point does not match expectedType.
        See Also:
        Bond.spy(String, Class)

      • spy

        public <T> SpyResult<T> spy(String spyPointName,
                            Class<T> expectedType,
                            boolean skipSaveObservation)
        Spies this point with the current observation, expecting a return type of expectedType. Has no effect and returns an absent SpyResult if Bond.isActive() is false.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Same as expectedType
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on
        expectedType - Type of value expected to be returned from any active SpyAgent
        skipSaveObservation - If true, don't actually save the observation; all other relevant SpyAgent actions are still performed. This will be overridden by the skipSaveObservation field of a SpyAgent.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.
        Throws:
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the result from the agent matching this spy point does not match expectedType.
        See Also:
        Bond.spy(String, Class, boolean)

      • spyWithException

        public void spyWithException(String spyPointName)
                      throws Exception
        Spies this point with no observation, expecting an Exception to be thrown. Has no effect if Bond.isActive() is false.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an Exception is available on the SpyAgent deployed for this point (if any).
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the SpyAgent available for this point is not a SpyAgent.SpyAgentWithCheckedException.
        See Also:
        Bond.spyWithException(String)

      • spyWithException

        public <E extends Exception> void spyWithException(String spyPointName,
                                                   Class<E> expectedException)
                                            throws E extends Exception
        Spies this point with no observations, expecting a checked Exception of type expectedException to be thrown. Has no effect if Bond.isActive() is false.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Same as expectedException.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        expectedException - Type of Exception expected to be available on any SpyAgent deployed for this point (if any).
        Throws:
        E - If an Exception is available on the SpyAgent deployed for this point (if any).
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the type of Exception available on the SpyAgent for this point is not compatible with E, or if the agent is not a SpyAgent.SpyAgentWithCheckedException.
        E extends Exception
        See Also:
        Bond.spyWithException(String, Class)
